result.execSummary:
The defendant Spencer E. Springwater was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 3:32  Defendant Spencer E. Springwater in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Defendant Spencer E. Springwater in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich- Ct 2 Jail    concurrent to MN case.  Ct 3 Jail 6 mo conc to Ct 2 and MN Case   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 2 & 3   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 2 & 3.  Ct 1 is dismissed. Court orders   Ct 2 30 days PC Jail  Ct 3 6 mo PC Jail conc to each other and to the MN sentence now serving.  Expungment will be granted if successfully completes.  Froelinch will do amended information to day for dismissed case. Defendant will go back to St Cloud MN  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing at 12-07-2015 03:00 pm.
C Bub

Pre-trial conference at 04-07-2015 02:00 pm.

District Attorney Sean Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Spencer E. Springwater in Court with Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.    Case called at 10:14 a.m.  S/T Pierce County Deputy Spencer Fobbe.  Direct by DA Froelich.  Defendant identified.  Cross by Atty. Harrelson.  Atty. Harrelson states argument.  DA Froelich states argument, feels State has met its burden and requests bindover.  Court makes findings; notes testimony and finds sufficient evidence that Defendant probably committed a felony and binds Defendant over for trial.  State presents Court with Information.  Court confirms Defendant has a copy, reads charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived, Defendant enters NG pleas to Counts 1-3.  Court reiterates that bond continues, advises of conditions.  Atty. Harrelson notes that Defendant may be facing charges in MN and will advise if he is taken into custody.  Court reiterates that address always needs to be current.
J Harrelson
Preliminary hearing at 02-27-2015 10:00 am
